column1: A porter brushed by her as she stood there with a glass of milk in his hand. Sahwah watched the progress of the milk idly
column2: and the porter stopped beside the Lieutenant of Aviation with it. The lieutenant seemed to be asleep
column3: for the porter had to shake him before he became aware of his existence. Just then Hinpoha caught Sahwah's eye and motioned her to come back to her seat
column4: and Sahwah went tripping down the aisle to join her friends. She glanced casually at the young lieutenant as she passed him; he was staring fixedly at her and she dropped her eyes quickly. A little electric shock tingled through her as she met his eyes; he seemed to be about to speak to her. "Probably mistook me for someone else and thought he knew me
column5: Sahwah thought to herself, and dismissed him from her mind.
